result.execSummary:
The defendant Sebastian D Faust was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To be paid forthwith - In lieu of payment defendant to serve 5 days, concurrent to the 175 days and concurrent to Milwaukee County Case 10CF4499.

Huber with standard release conditions, commencing forthwith.

Concurrent with: Milwaukee County Case 10CF4499.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Sebastian D Faust in court, in custody (OTP'd from MSDF), with attorney Tedia K. Gamino by atty. Nicole Buttery.

Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.
Repeater enhancer is struck.




Court orders the following:
175 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
Concurrent to:  present sentence (Milwaukee County Case 10CF4499)

Costs:  $243
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  Court Waives.
To be paid Forthwith - In Lieu of Payment defendant to serve 5 Days Concurrent to the 175 Days but Concurrent to Milwaukee County Case 10CF4499.


Defendant to be returned to MSDF - FORTHWITH.
